t: Luke 21
The Widow’s Offering
As*p Jesus looked up, he saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.
He also saw a poor widow put in two very small copper coins.
“Truly*r I*r tell*r you,”*r he said, “this*r poor*r widow*r has*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all*r the*r others.*r
All*r these*r people*r gave*r their*r gifts*r out*r of*r their*r wealth;*r but*r she*r out*r of*r her*r poverty*r put*r in*r all*r she*r had*r to*r live*r on.”*r
The Destruction of the Temple and Signs of the End Times
Some*p of his disciples were remarking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and with gifts dedicated to God. But Jesus said,
“As*r for*r what*r you*r see*r here,*r the*r time*r will*r come*r when*r not*r one*r stone*r will*r be*r left*r on*r another;*r every*r one*r of*r them*r will*r be*r thrown*r down.”*r
“Teacher,”*p they asked, “when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?”

He*p replied: “Watch*r out*r that*r you*r are*r not*r deceived.*r For*r many*r will*r come*r in*r my*r name,*r claiming,*r ‘I*r am*r he,’*r and,*r ‘The*r time*r is*r near.’*r Do*r not*r follow*r them.*r
When*r you*r hear*r of*r wars*r and*r uprisings,*r do*r not*r be*r frightened.*r These*r things*r must*r happen*r first,*r but*r the*r end*r will*r not*r come*r right*r away.”*r
Then*p he said to them: “Nation*r will*r rise*r against*r nation,*r and*r kingdom*r against*r kingdom.*r
There*r will*r be*r great*r earthquakes,*r famines*r and*r pestilences*r in*r various*r places,*r and*r fearful*r events*r and*r great*r signs*r from*r heaven.*r

“But*rp before*r all*r this,*r they*r will*r seize*r you*r and*r persecute*r you.*r They*r will*r hand*r you*r over*r to*r synagogues*r and*r put*r you*r in*r prison,*r and*r you*r will*r be*r brought*r before*r kings*r and*r governors,*r and*r all*r on*r account*r of*r my*r name.*r
And*r so*r you*r will*r bear*r testimony*r to*r me.*r
But*r make*r up*r your*r mind*r not*r to*r worry*r beforehand*r how*r you*r will*r defend*r yourselves.*r
For*r I*r will*r give*r you*r words*r and*r wisdom*r that*r none*r of*r your*r adversaries*r will*r be*r able*r to*r resist*r or*r contradict.*r
You*r will*r be*r betrayed*r even*r by*r parents,*r brothers*r and*r sisters,*r relatives*r and*r friends,*r and*r they*r will*r put*r some*r of*r you*r to*r death.*r
Everyone*r will*r hate*r you*r because*r of*r me.*r
But*r not*r a*r hair*r of*r your*r head*r will*r perish.*r
Stand*r firm,*r and*r you*r will*r win*r life.*r
“When*rp you*r see*r Jerusalem*r being*r surrounded*r by*r armies,*r you*r will*r know*r that*r its*r desolation*r is*r near.*r
Then*r let*r those*r who*r are*r in*r Judea*r flee*r to*r the*r mountains,*r let*r those*r in*r the*r city*r get*r out,*r and*r let*r those*r in*r the*r country*r not*r enter*r the*r city.*r
For*r this*r is*r the*r time*r of*r punishment*r in*r fulfillment*r of*r all*r that*r has*r been*r written.*r

How*r dreadful*r it*r will*r be*r in*r those*r days*r for*r pregnant*r women*r and*r nursing*r mothers!*r There*r will*r be*r great*r distress*r in*r the*r land*r and*r wrath*r against*r this*r people.*r

They*r will*r fall*r by*r the*r sword*r and*r will*r be*r taken*r as*r prisoners*r to*r all*r the*r nations.*r Jerusalem*r will*r be*r trampled*r on*r by*r the*r Gentiles*r until*r the*r times*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r are*r fulfilled.*r

“There*rp will*r be*r signs*r in*r the*r sun,*r moon*r and*r stars.*r On*r the*r earth,*r nations*r will*r be*r in*r anguish*r and*r perplexity*r at*r the*r roaring*r and*r tossing*r of*r the*r sea.*r
People*r will*r faint*r from*r terror,*r apprehensive*r of*r what*r is*r coming*r on*r the*r world,*r for*r the*r heavenly*r bodies*r will*r be*r shaken.*r
At*r that*r time*r they*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r a*r cloud*r with*r power*r and*r great*r glory.*r
When*r these*r things*r begin*r to*r take*r place,*r stand*r up*r and*r lift*r up*r your*r heads,*r because*r your*r redemption*r is*r drawing*r near.”*r
He*p told them this parable: “Look*r at*r the*r fig*r tree*r and*r all*r the*r trees.*r
When*r they*r sprout*r leaves,*r you*r can*r see*r for*r yourselves*r and*r know*r that*r summer*r is*r near.*r
Even*r so,*r when*r you*r see*r these*r things*r happening,*r you*r know*r that*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r near.*r

Heaven*r and*r earth*r will*r pass*r away,*r but*r my*r words*r will*r never*r pass*r away.*r

“Be*rp careful,*r or*r your*r hearts*r will*r be*r weighed*r down*r with*r carousing,*r drunkenness*r and*r the*r anxieties*r of*r life,*r and*r that*r day*r will*r close*r on*r you*r suddenly*r like*r a*r trap.*r
For*r it*r will*r come*r on*r all*r those*r who*r live*r on*r the*r face*r of*r the*r whole*r earth.*r

Be*r always*r on*r the*r watch,*r and*r pray*r that*r you*r may*r be*r able*r to*r escape*r all*r that*r is*r about*r to*r happen,*r and*r that*r you*r may*r be*r able*r to*r stand*r before*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.”*r
Each*p day Jesus was teaching at the temple, and each evening he went out to spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives,
and all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.
